group_1.textLeft: *Huff*...*huff*...

group_1.textRight: Sorry...! It's my fault for pushing you too hard...
Here's a Grief Seed, use it...!

group_1.textLeft: Thank you...
But we're too conspicuous here...@Let's change our location...

group_1.textRight: ...I'm really sorry.
I thought I was prepared to face any Witch, but...

group_1.textLeft: When your own sister is your opponent,@I can't blame you for hesitating...
You've been eating and sleeping together under@the same roof until just recently...
Then she suddenly disappeared, only to return@with this form...
I can only imagine what you're feeling...

group_1.textRight: She was adorable... The cutest little sister in@the whole world...
Even though she was mischievous and sometimes@made me angry,
I could forgive her for anything...
Next time, let's go to the city together,@just the two of us!
I promised we would...
[chara:770701:effect_shake]......?!

group_1.textLeft: I'm sorry...
I don't know what to say at a time like this...

group_1.textRight: Ugh...*Sniffle*...urk...

group_1.textLeft: ...This Grief Seed mustn't be used only for me.
Even though your sister's appearance@has changed,
she's still here by your side, healing you...
That she survived until now without being@defeated by anyone,
maybe she wanted to reunite with her older@sister and say hello...
Welcome back, Rabi-chan.

group_1.textRight: Professor.

group_1.textLeft: You haven't seen the news about Yukuni City@yet, have you?

group_1.textRight: I have not.@Have there been any changes?

group_1.textLeft: I was watching with your mother just a bit ago.
They spoke about how the number of accidents@that had been on the rise were down today.

group_1.textRight: Really...?!

group_1.textLeft: We're finally seeing the results that Rabi-chan@and her friends have been working so hard for.

group_1.textRight: It's all thanks to you, Professor, that things have@become so much easier for us.
We were just trying to accept the hatred of the@Eradicators and put an end to it,
when you reminded us of our original desire to@be saved.
And thanks to you, the hearts of the students@were moved.
I can't thank you enough.

group_1.textLeft: I just did what I could, and I'm grateful too.
I'm trying to prove that Magical Girls can be saved.

group_1.textRight: Still, we don't know the outcome yet.

group_1.textLeft: That's true.
However, it is Magical Girls who hold hope,
and we who believe in them, believe in hope, too.

group_1.textRight: ...Of course.
